This is a great game, but there a few problems with it. The first problem some might have is that it may seem a bit dated, this wasn't a problem for me, but I know a few people who might not like that. The second thing is there are a few glitches, and I will give an example of one that happened to me. There is a spot where you come up against HECU Snipers and must elimnate them before moving on, otherwise they will just kill you everytime. Now to kill these snipers you must use grenades and throw them up into their nests. Now the glitch for me was that no grenades spawned for me, either that or this wasn't a glitch, and the grenades are you just very easy to miss, in which case that makes this even worse. The only way i could move on was to use console commands to cheat and give myself grenades. Now besides that, I didn't have any other problems, and would reccommend this game to anyone who likes FPS games, or valve in general.
Know what you're getting into when playing this! It's not a modern shooter! I've had some fun with it but Black Mesa is the way to play the game.
Why don't you have it yet?

Disclaimer: This is an opinionated review, so some of my opinion might show occaisionally, whether you agree or not is up to you, and I respect your opinion. It also contains mostly no spoilers except the final paragraph.

Half-Life 1 was a science-fiction FPS shooter first released in 1998 that revolutionized narriative in FPSs and Games in general. It was the story about a scientist named Gordon Freeman (our silent protagonist) escaping the Black Mesa after a dimension-colliding event known as the Ressonance Cascade brings forth several hostile creatures from Xen. 

What do I think of it? Well for starters here's the pros and cons

Pros: Great use of combining narriative with gameplay and immersion, story is great, gameplay is awesome, weapon and skill progression is well-implemented, boss fights are fun (with the exception of Gargantuas and the tesla coil), level design is well-made and memorable, good shooting mechanics and controls, shift-jump is awesome, upgrading to a new weapon feels rewarding and gives a sense of progression, the chapter names sound awesome (maybe that's just me).

Cons: Platforming is outdated and the controls for it are incredibly slippery, some levels can seem unfair, a few minor glitches (like a glarring one in Aprehension wherein Gordon can be stuck in a black room after the cutscene when the soldiers drag him through the hallway), HD Models is the default and turning it off still has a few things of the original game that are missing/modified, hit-box issues with headcrabs for melee, tons of frustration.

Despite the amount of cons, the pros manage to outweigh them (at least in my opinion), Half-Life 1 was a revolutionary step for first-person shooters and narriative and honestly, I wish there were more games like Half-Life, especially in it's setting, plot, level-design and progression in general (not in it's platforming though).

Another con I forgot to mention (I left this last since it's incredibly opinionated), when I finished the game, I felt a sense of nostalgia, a sense of acomplishment, a sense of everything coming to fruition. Sure I was enjoyed the journey, but I wanted to see Gordon back home, and seeing him be locked by The G-Man himself made me go play Half-Life 2 to see what would happen. This would normally be a pro but then when I finished that game I ended up playing through the rest of the episodes to see what would happen, then I finally got to that goddamn cliff-hanger. And now everyday, I await for a Half-Life 3, so we can finally see Gordon reach the goal he wanted to reach ever since the first game, to finally go back home and for everything to go back to normal. 

In all honestly, I recommend it, but if those cons or anything I mention is something that you wouldn't enjoy, then it's up to you whether to pick up the game or not.



Edit: Now Nominated for Steam Awards 2017

WOW!

those bee fuckers are annoying
Theres a reason why this game is viewed not only as a classic, but as one of the best games in history. It's because this game is, personally, the best game I've ever played.

You can't go too wrong with the classics. This is where all of valve started. Hell, You wouldn't even be reading this review if it wasn't for this game, as Steam probably wouldn't even exist. Innovative as hell for it's time, as being one of the first games to have an expansive story, this game gives you the controller and never takes it away. The storytelling is pretty good for it's time, and the gameplay is still solid too this day. There is an expansivly fun arsenal, and many enemies are very unique and rememberable, such as the headcrabs. The presentation and graphics are also really good for the time, probably being some of the best there was when it came out. The game also has a very lonely feeling, as you have to escape Black Mesa all on your own, with no cutscenes, very little people, ammo, and health supplies, and hardly any music, which only slowly fades in when something big is about to happen. The whole game makes you always feel careful, as the whole place is full of dangerous aliens and it's slowly falling apart. Half-Life is an amazing game that uses a system that Valve has built upon for years, only improving it more and more ever since.

9/10

A real classic, and although it was made in 1998, still a really great game. I have to say, I played Half Life 2 and it's episodes before this one because I already knew the story, but I eventually decided to play this. This is hands down the hardest game of the series and one of the hardest games I have ever played. Some levels I have less than 10 health and very low ammo, leading to 10 respawns where I have to do get health from one area and kill 10 enemies and run through 5 rooms before I can get health again.
The single player is superb, the multiplayer is more dead than Harambe. 9/10

This is a game I can finish in like 4 hours MAX, because I finished it like 100 times when I was in kindergarten. Damn, time flies but some things never change. The persistent thing here in timestasis is Half-Life itself. Still, the undisputed champion among all PC games. If you are a PC gamer that plays First Person Shooters and have never finished Half Life, then your life is an abyss I donot want to think about.
Best story ever!
Basically, it's the best game made, before the best game made, was made.

If you don't mind 1998 graphics, this is the best game of all time. This game was modded to create other popular games like counter strike, and team fortress. Less known, this game also was modded to create GMod. 

This game was perfectly executed in gameplay, it's not too easy and it's not too hard. It has puzzles, it has survival, it has action. You start with the iconic crowbar, and work your way up to the gravity gun? ( I forget what it's called but it's awesome ) 

If your a younger kid, don't think that you won't like this old timey game. This is great if you are on vacation, with no internet, and your playing on the suckiest laptop you have. A potato can run this game.

I strongly reccomend everyone buy this game, because on sale, it's only 50 cents.

[h1] Review of Half Life 1 [/h1]

So I always try to continue the meme of "Where is Half life 3?", but the it struck me... I haven't even played the original game and I should be ashamed of that!

I picked up the game for 3$, fired it up and instantly fell in love with it. When starting I kinda wanted to freerun the game as the mechanics felt so good. Of course they weren't realistic as the new games, but sometimes I just wish more games would be done this way( without the wobbly left right movement). AS I tried to rush the game I soon realized this game requiered some skill. So I had to be a little more strategic. I loved the storyand the monsters in the game. Sometimes I found it too easy to advance into the next chapter as some enemies were stupid like hell, most of the time I strugeled to advance(Ok, I admit. I looked up a yt tutorial).
The thing that bothered me the most was the audio quality. Now I'm no programmer, but I think they could have done better even in 1999.
Weapon handling was also a blast and found some wepons to be quite unique. To recap all of this in a sentence I would have to say: If you enjoy a game with a fine story, good weapons, bad AI and good graphics (for it's time), this is the game for you.
I somewhat enjoyed the game in the same way I enjoyed the oringinal doom. This is the game that set a new industry standard and would be a shame if you didn't have it in your library. Overall this game is a 9/10.

Игра с очень глубоким сюжетом, может быть с самым лучшим...
Помню когда я первый раз поиграл в Half-Life, я думал что это обычный шутер, как Call of Duty...
([u]Ой как я ошибался, как же я ошибался...[/u])
Эта игра произвела такое впечатление, о котором я и подумать не мог...
Плохая графика меня совсем не расстроила, ([u]я понимаю что игра старая, а тогда вот эту графику называли лучшей...[/u])
Так что если для тебя самое главное, сюжет и атмосфера в игре, а не графика, советую купить...
Разработчики Valve очень молодцы, они смогли своей первой игрой завоевать сердца фанатов...
Эх, не представляю как бы мы жили без [b]Гейба[/b]...
([u]Вот не понимаю таких людей, которые ценят игры по графике а не по сюжету, по дате выхода можно понять что графика не как в GTA 5...[/u])
Так что такой легендарной игре, ставлю 10 миров Xen из 10...
([u]Кстати после прохождения вам захочется пройти [b]Black Mesa[/b], ну если вы ещё не играли в неё...[/u])

Удивительное приключение, которое в своё время я прошёл с какого-то пиратского диска, теперь, из уважения к его создателям, заставляет меня покупать все игры VALVE только в лицензионной версии. Maximum nostalgia.

It's a great game overall. I went into this game knowing almost nothing about it. Even forgetting the name of this game before I got it.

Half-Life is a amazing game with a lot of things in the game to support this opinion.

The game is a great experience even for casual gamers. When I first went into the game I didn't think there would be much of a "play your own way" kind of story. For example you can follow a path of a "normal" protagonist, Or you can kill everyone...yea. 

There were more great things in this game but if you want them I would reccomend playing the game. This next part will talk about the cons of this game. 

The story overall is pretty easy to understand. But I did have some trouble with the gameplay. Some times I found my self looking for what to do with no guid. It gives you the feel of making your own choices but some directions would be nice.

this game brings me back to the good old days 99/100

A historical gaming gem that revolutionized first person shooters and marked the first step in advanced gaming technology.

You are Gorden Freeman, a Black Mesa scientist who is late to work. You head off to find your bio-hazard suit and assist in an experiment that will create a portal to another world.

But once that lever is pulled, there is no going back. 

All hell has broken loose, an alien invasion is underway, and you are all alone, only armed with what you can find while searching for any survivors.

Your objective is to survive, escape to the surface, find the source of the invasion, and destroy their leader.

Find a variety of weapons while exploring vast environments. Fight both the aliens and the military who wish to erase any evidence of Black Mesa, the scientists, and your existance. 

There is a mysterious man with a brief case. He wants to form a proposition with you.

So I bought this recently (the game is as almost as old as me) after seeing how acclaimed it was as a revolutionary FPS. And after playing 5 hours a day for several days I can honestly say that, if you are genuinely looking for a solid game (and not good graphics) you will LOVE this game. The gunplay is seamless, the conversations are real and somehow funny (and if they aren't, go ahead and shoot the scientist), and the level design is phenominal. This is still better than any other singleplayer fps out there. Buy it. You know you want to.

The game has a lot of cool iteractions to make this game more imersive. The game also has puzzles in some areas to give you a break from just shooting things. Enough talk and to get down to the point. YOU NEED TO BUY THIS GAME.

Half-Life is one of the most highly regarded FPS of all time, with interesting story and approach to create immersion. Played today it's still rather entertaining, but it's important to adjust expectations regarding the technical aspects (e.g. graphics, game mechanics, precision of control), considering that the game was originally released in 1998. It's probably better to wait for a significant discount before buying it.
